Have you ever worked in a prison? I did in California for 23 years and your broad generalizations are offensive. In California inmates are put in solitary because they run out of options. They assaulted staff and inmates repeatedly. Many are high shot callers in the gangs and are out of control. Where should be put them? Ad Seg? So they can prey on the weak there?
What you clearly do not get is many of those in solitary are high profile inmates. They kicked off a serious riot, shanked multiple enemies. Just where would you put them? Would you be willing to pay more in taxes to fund this special unit you want?
How can you cay solitary is dirty. Prove it. I want documentation.
Substandard food? Prove it. Show me documentation.

On our unit we did "majors" once a week. They washed the walls, stripped the floors and waxed them, scrubbed the shower walls and floors, the urinals. They did EVERYTHING. They had a washer and dryer at their disposal. They had intramurals and many jobs You don't have clue what you are talking about.

Glad you were healed but prisons need to be reformed and indefinite solitary confinement is wrong.

As to your view that only you have the right to have an opinion on this issue, you are incorrect. As a citizen, I have the right to have an opinion particularly on an issue of public interest like prisons.

I read my comment sir. Where did I specifically say you could not have an opinion.  Show me.  You want to reform prisons?  Increase mental health beds and staff. Be proactive not reactive. Do what we did.  We had a special unit just for the mental health cases and they received much more extensive one on one treatment.  How can you  make such ridiculous statements and think I won't challenge it?  Solitary sucks but what you don't know is prison staff will routinely go and talk to them.  If they will not commit to engaging in violence or they actually come out and tell you  what are we suppose to do? Put them back in general pop so they can order a hit on a rival?  Have you ever been assaulted by a 23/1 guy?  I was 7 times. They like to, as we say Pearl Harbor us or to you sucker punch. They wait until you are engaged with someone, sneak up and drill us. I had one guy spit in my face repeatedly trying to provoke me.  I was gassed. These people are bad people and You just can't put them in general pop. They are too  dangerous. It is for the safety of the inmates. Many of these pillars of society will go right back to what they did before. California spends $1 billion a year housing illegal felons. We have over 2,450.  How many do you have? Its not as simple as you seem to think it is. And the forestry guys who go out and fight fires? They whined about eating T bone steaks and boneless chicken breasts. They are not deprived of anything I don't care what you think

"Vulnerable inmates" should not be held in solitary. They should be held in special units where their safety can be assured. Punishing them for being vulnerable is an appalling policy.

Solitary confinement should be used very sparingly and then only for short periods. Further solitary confinement should not be in "holes" with substandard food. The entire idea that an inmate is put in a very small cell that is dirty and run down and fed food one wouldn't throw away is appalling.

Why aren't our prisons clean and well kept. We certainly spend enough on them. Private prisons are allowed to make millions by cutting health care and food budgets and charging inmates obscene fees for phone calls to relatives. The entire system is broken but the use of solitary is one of the most flagrant and disgusting abuse of human rights that is going on daily In this country.

The problem is, most people incarcerated are eventually going to be released, not everyone in prison is there for life. If they are kept in conditions that makes them more prone to violence, what happens when they are released? Our prison system has given up on attempts at rehabilitation and only punishes. By now we should have learn better how to help offenders deal with society once their debt to society has been paid.

A cogent thought, but it is necessary to keep in mind that nations sometimes act suicidally. Factions within them certainly do. I'm more concerned about the Pakistan bombs once that failing state collapses than the mythical Iranian bomb.

And, it is in our interest to honor our Agreement with Iran.  The IAEA sent in inspectors and they found no bomb making facilities.  The centrifuges are in place for medical equipment which they are free to develop.  The continued "war" nonsense with Iran is promoted by only one country: Israel.  Israel is not threatened by Iran; in fact, Israel has nuclear war heads on the border of Iran.  Israel is not afraid of Iran's ability to develop a nuclear bomb; Israel is afraid of Iran's entry into world markets, and to be a player in the world.  Iran is an educated, modern country; she has every right to be a part of the world.  The time has long passed for Israel to make our foreign policy regarding Iran.  Israel has attacked and invaded Gaza; Israel has prevented fishermen from Gaza from using their own waters to fish; Israelis sit on the West Bank and throw stones at Palestinian shepherds; Israel has bulldozed Palestinian homes.  Palestine is not an aggressor in that neighborhood, Israel is.  Extremists in Iran yelling Death to America are no different than our Tea Party extremists.  Iran controls the Straits of Hormuz, and we need to deal with Iran as we do any other country in that region.  Israel also needs to deal with Iran as a neighbor, rather than as an enemy.
